title: data-sveltekit-preload-data="hover" not present on body in lib template
body:
### Describe the bug

The library template of `npm create svelte` does not have `data-sveltekit-preload-data="hover"` on the body tag in app.html unlike the other two templates.

It had me a little confused why hovering links weren't preloading anything until I re-read the docs and saw:
> The default project template has a data-sveltekit-preload-data="hover" attribute applied to the <body> element in src/app.html

then realising the library template does not have this applied.

I can't immediately think of any reason this would be purposely left out of the library template, and I couldn't find any issue mentioning it.

### Reproduction

`pnpm create svelte@latest` and choose the library template

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: macOS 13.2.1
    CPU: (10) arm64 Apple M1 Max
    Memory: 24.89 GB / 64.00 GB
    Shell: 5.8.1 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.14.0 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.0/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.19 - ~/.yarn/bin/yarn
    npm: 9.3.1 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.14.0/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 112.0.5615.137
    Firefox: 109.0.1
    Safari: 16.3
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: ^2.0.0 => 2.0.1 
    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.5.0 => 1.16.2 
    @sveltejs/package: ^2.0.0 => 2.0.2 
    svelte: ^3.54.0 => 3.59.0 
    vite: ^4.3.0 => 4.3.5
```


### Severity

annoyance

### Additional Information

_No response_
